I'm saddened by the devastating events that took place in Blacksburg last night. My thoughts go to the loved ones of the victims, as well as all the Blacksburg and Virginia Tech community.

Rumors are that middleman staffing agencies keep as much as 40% of the money they charge for nurses instead of giving more of the money to the nurses.

I do not and will not support legislation to cap nurses’ pay. Anything to the contrary is fake news.
The bipartisan letter I sent to the White House asks about potential illegal practices by staffing agencies that charge high rates and then keep that money for themselves, not nurses.

Disinformation continues to circulate that I have introduced a bill to cap nurses’ pay. That is false.

There is no bill, and I do not support capping nurses’ pay.

2021 data shows why it’s needed. More fentanyl than heroin was smuggled across our border for the first time, leading to an alarming increase in overdoses and deaths. https://t.co/H42JFprXA8

As a result of the Court’s decision today, the vaccine mandate will drive workers away from hospitals, nursing homes, long-term care homes, and other Medicare- and Medicaid-funded facilities. Patient care will suffer as a result.

The Supreme Court was right to block President Biden’s vaccine mandate on private employers. I wish it had done the same to the Administration’s mandate on health care providers. Health care workers should not have to shoulder more burdens imposed by the Federal Government.
But why should we be surprised she connects this issue with NASA? Speaker Pelosi has always been out of touch with this world and probably also favors giving the vote to extraterrestrials.

Speaker Pelosi’s latest gambit to federalize elections takes a bill about NASA and loads it with provisions to undermine election security: taking away state powers, putting up hurdles to voter ID, and blocking voter roll maintenance. It’s a desperate stunt.

New this morning: the Labor Department confirms that prices rose in December by 7%, the highest rate of inflation since 1982.

This is more evidence that the Biden agenda is failing the American people.

-federalized election administration
-legalized ballot harvesting
-taxpayer dollars for political candidates

@boblatta Our bill doesn’t stop there. It streamlines research on fentanyl analogues so we can better understand the effects of these substances.

There are as many as 4,800 fentanyl analogues. We have data on fewer than 30 of them – in other words, fewer than one percent of them.

Fentanyl related substances are contributing to the surge in overdose deaths, but under current law, their temporary placement in Schedule I expires in February. The HALT Fentanyl Act introduced by @boblatta and I would make that scheduling permanent. https://t.co/XcEiqMaf7b

Eighty years ago was “a date which will live in infamy.”

Imperial Japanese forces launched a surprise attack on Pearl Harbor, killing more than 2,400 Americans. The United States formally entered World War II the next day. https://t.co/ZLJd4CiOoc

Bob Dole was one of the great statesmen of the Greatest Generation. He overcame a horrific injury in World War II to faithfully serve his country in the House, the Senate, and as a Republican presidential candidate. His long and honorable career was a true American success story.

I was honored when he repaid the favor by assisting me in my first race for the House of Delegates. 

A true gentleman and patriot, John Warner will be missed but not forgotten.

I was his campaign’s Emory & Henry College coordinator during his first fight for the Republican nomination for Senate. I fondly remember putting signs together in the modest hotel suite of the future senator and his then-wife Elizabeth Taylor.

John Warner was an old friend. More importantly for the country and the Commonwealth, he was a giant of VA politics. For five terms he represented VA with distinction in the U.S. Senate, and among his achievements, he helped drive the military expansion that won the Cold War.
